introduction: This session discusses agile project management and its relevance, principles, and implementation steps. It also covers different frameworks and companies that use agile project management.

sections.title: Section 1: Introduction to Agile Project Management
content: Agile project management is a flexible approach to building projects.
Projects are broken down into sprints, with each sprint delivering sections of the project or mini-projects.
The process of project management in agile is agile-based, with no central control of project manager.
Agile project management helps organizations stay ahead in competition by delivering high-quality products with fewer chances of failure.

sections.title: Section 2: Agile Project Management Principles
content: There are 10 principles for successful agile project management.
Principle 1: The satisfaction of the customer by delivering the project fast and with least effort.
Principle 2: There must be a feeling of trust and support towards the team to complete the projects objectives.
Principle 3: Facetoface conversations with the development team help in both solving problems and easy knowledge sharing.
Principle 4: Scrum tools like mondaycom or zoho sprints must be used to evolve the project over time.

sections.title: Section 3: Agile Project Management Frameworks
content: Scrum is a simple framework that helps teams work together and learn through experiences.
The hybrid framework combines agile methodology with non-agile methodology.
The lean framework works on the principle of providing maximum customer value and creating zero waste.
The hybrid framework handles requirement changes and delivers the product.
The lean framework simplifies the process of information management and makes it more accurate.

sections.title: Section 4: Agile Project Management Implementation Steps
content: Agile project management involves several steps.
Release planning ensures the release of features at the end of each cycle and smaller development cycles.
Sprint planning involves stakeholders to show the finished product and build a relationship.
Sprint review and sprint retrospective help in discussing what went well and what went wrong during the sprint.
Agile project management helps organizations stay ahead in competition by delivering high-quality products with fewer chances of failure.

sections.title: Section 5: Companies Using Agile Project Management
content: Around 22 percent of organizations worldwide have all their teams working on the principle of agile project management.
Prominent companies like IBM, Cisco, AT&T, Microsoft, Philips, and Samsung use agile project management.
Agile project management helps organizations stay ahead in competition by delivering high-quality products with fewer chances of failure.
Agile project management enables organizations to adapt to changes quickly and efficiently.
Agile project management fosters collaboration and communication among team members.
topics: Prominent Companies Using Agile Project Management
